Package com.illposed.osc.utility

Class OSCJavaToByteArrayConverter

java.lang.Object
com.illposed.osc.utility.OSCJavaToByteArrayConverter
public class OSCJavaToByteArrayConverter
extends java.lang.Object
OSCJavaToByteArrayConverter is a helper class that translates from Java types to their byte stream representations according to the OSC spec. The implementation is based on Markus Gaelli and Iannis Zannos's OSC implementation in Squeak (a Smalltalk dialect). This version includes bug fixes and improvements from Martin Kaltenbrunner and Alex Potsides.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected static long MSB_0_BASE_TIME
    baseline NTP time if bit-0=0 is 7-Feb-2036 @ 06:28:16 UTC
    protected static long MSB_1_BASE_TIME
    baseline NTP time if bit-0=1 is 1-Jan-1900 @ 01:00:00 UTC

    • javaToNtpTimeStamp

      protected static long javaToNtpTimeStamp​(long javaTime)
      Converts a Java time-stamp to a 64-bit NTP time representation. This code was copied in from the "Apache Jakarta Commons - Net" library, which is licensed under the ASF 2.0 license. The original source file can be found here.
      Parameters:
      javaTime - Java time-stamp, as returned by Date.getTime()
      Returns:
      NTP time-stamp representation of the Java time value.

    • write

      public void write​(java.lang.String aString)
      Write a string into the byte stream.
      Parameters:
      aString - the string to be written

    • write

      public void write​(java.lang.Character aChar)
      Write a char into the byte stream, and ensure it is 4 byte aligned again.
      Parameters:
      aChar - the character to be written

    • write

      public void write​(char aChar)
      Write a char into the byte stream. CAUTION, this does not ensure 4 byte alignment (it actually breaks it)!
      Parameters:
      aChar - the character to be written

    • write

      public void write​(java.lang.Object anObject)
      Write an object into the byte stream.
      Parameters:
      anObject - (usually) one of Float, Double, String, Character, Integer, Long, or array of these.

    • writeType

      public void writeType​(java.lang.Class typeClass)
      Write the OSC specification type tag for the type a certain Java type converts to.
      Parameters:
      typeClass - Class of a Java object in the arguments

      Parameters:
      arguments - the arguments to an OSCMessage
